The claim was published by a New Zealand: based Facebook user on September 29, 2020, and has been shared more than 490 times.
The graphic accompanying the claim featu: 3. The text in the graphic suggests that Judith Collins opposes the Resource Management Act (R.M.Act) because her husband is a director of Oravida, a Chinese-based water bottling company. However, Oravida is actually a New Zealand-based company that exports water and dairy products to China.
Judith Collins: husband, David Wong-Tung, was previously a director of Oravida but no longer holds that position as of October 2020, according to filings on the New Zealand Companies Register website.
